reviews.text: I have stayed at this property before when in the city of Abu Dhabi and usually its decent enough for me to return, but this time I won't be returning. I was given a smoking room which was fine I did not mind but the power went out at 3am when I went to the bathroom. It took over 15mins to fix and several calls to the front desk. Then at 8am or so the power went again after switched on the lights. The agent at the front desk called me and told me the maintenance guy said I had something in my room. I told her that he had said there is a problem with the lights, she offered to move me at this time but I was not going to move everything when I was checking out in 5 hrs, so I stayed in a room without lights. I called and requested a 1pm check out only to be called at 12:10pm to be asked what time I am checking out. Upon check out a guy who I think was the manger (no Nametag ) asked me if I had a problem with electricity in the room. I said yes , he asked if it was fixed I said no and that was it no apology. Great service recovery guys !!! keep it up !
reviews.title: No power, no apology
Budget Hotel with no much frills

reviews.text: I stayed there for 5 nights on my business trip and found the place good, not so great but not bad at all. Breaffast was nice in a small cozy restauranton 1st floor.
reviews.title: Thank you

reviews.text: Hotel is neat and tidy. It was all vacant but while booking we booked it they charged 20% extra amount siting some conference in Abu Dhabi and non availability.
reviews.title: Comfortable, clean room. Very pleased overall.
Secure In the Middle of the City

reviews.text: i like room there is much space and amenability and location in abu dhabi it's too closed to market near to lulu and emirates market
reviews.title: its ok

reviews.text: A nice hotel in the heart of the city; in my opinion focused for middle management in short business trips. The rooms are big, with internet (I was told against payment, but in my case was charged through company), some of them with nice view.
reviews.title: a hotel for business travels

reviews.text: The problem is that is boring, as alcohol-free, with a buffet type restaurant, another one (Italian style) and a small cafeteria at ground-floor. Thant's all. The buffet type is serving only Indian food (very hot & spicy) so if you don't like it, use the Italian restaurant, with a good list and where the food is tasty. Don't be surprised if on dinner time you're alone in the Pepino (the name of the Italian restaurant), the chef will come personal to take your order.
reviews.title: Poor, from beginning to end

reviews.text: The hotel is clean, they provide early morning newspapers, the employees are very prompt, and in the area are a lot of restaurants, including fast-food ones, if you decide to eat outside of the hotel.
reviews.title: Overpriced
Very good
reviews.text: I recommend it for short business trips, as said; for family travels, better take one with much more entertainment, swimming pool.

The staff here were friendly as are most staff in the UAE. I did not want to take my frustrations out on the mild mannered staff, but I made my complaints as soon as I arrived. However, perhaps this tact did not work, being softly spoken to make a complaint does not get you anywhere. I made the complaint about the room upon arrival about the mould in my room and nothing happened.
reviews.title: Don't be fooled

reviews.text: To begin, the lobby is small and tatty. Whatever the case might have been in the past with the hotel in terms of looks, it has now faded away. The stair case is a remnant of what it once was.
reviews.title: no major changes from last year

reviews.text: The hallways are dark and dingy, the carpet looks dirty and stained.
reviews.title: Value for money

reviews.text: The bedroom is big, but the windows have not been cleaned in sometime, neither have the curtains been washed. The carpet was clean enough to walk on bare foot in the bed room. The furniture was old, knocked and chipped.
reviews.title: Abu Dhabi

reviews.text: However, the bathroom was something else. There was a small shower head with lime scale, rusty nails in the wall. The sealant, I could have done a better job and I am not a plumber, it was cracking and peeling. There was mould in the bathroom too.
reviews.title: Acceptable Cost Effective Business Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the stay was so nice ! The staff was so helpful . so kind , with good english . The reseption is poor I agree with some writings, but the room is just perfect, its so good , and so clean , its cleaned by them with no mistakes , all my clothes they put in the rigjht places , which mean they do not replace while cleaning .room does not hvae much spase like other people said , but it looks very cozy. With the money we booked it was so nice surprise to see that kind the room.
reviews.title: Very nice for the money we paid

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel for one night only. It was very comfortable stay. The room was large, the bathroom was big and clean, more room in the wardrobe than you will ever need. Find Pizza Hut, the hotel is behind this restaurant.
reviews.title: Comfortable

reviews.text: First things first, don't ask for the 'Grand Continental Flamingo', the hotel is just the Grand Continental on Hanman Road. The actual locations of hotels in this region seem to be secrets not shared by the agents websites.
reviews.title: Decent place for the money

reviews.text: I only stayed here for one night, but for 80 quid I got a big room with two double beds, good bathroom, good breakfast, and whilst it's not the bees knees, it's perfectly passable for the money. The only downside is that there is no alcohol served in the hotel, but you can walk five minutes to another hotel if you need a drink.
reviews.title: Ok hotel
